author: customer
text: The product descriptions and photos are absolutely abysmal. I understand that you guys are working at scale with huge quantities of merchandise, but dang, can we get some trustworthy measurements? I'm talking hip, thigh, leg opening, front rise, back rise, shoulder width, sleeve length, sleeve width. I used to work QC for an apparel company and I know that taking these measurements can be painstaking, but it would make it SO much easier to buy with confidence if I had more to go on than "mid rise, straight leg, size small" (which could apparently mean a wide variety of totally inequivalent sizes). And the photo quality! Black pants do not show up well when photographed against a white background with no close up details. I was SHOCKED to find that one of the pants I bought had a tuxedo stripe! Not only was it not visible in the pictures, it wasn't noted in the description! It would have been a pleasant surprise had the "measurements" been more accurate. Instead I have pants that don't fit that are not returnable due to the sale terms. NOT complaining about the price. Y'all keep doing those big sales. But if you're going to make deeply discounted merchandise non-returnable, at least let us know exactly what it is that we're buying. Feels like buying a mystery bag from a cheap fast fashion brand. (Will it fit? Will it look anything like the pictures? will it be made of the material it is listed as? Will it arrive looking like a garbage bag??) I get better descriptions, measurements, and pictures from sketchy eBay dealers than TRR. Unfortunately, I'm probably going to go back to buying secondhand designer direct from individuals since I can ask questions about the actual product and get actually helpful information.
title: going back to eBay

author: customer
text:
My bags arrived quickly. 
Was disappointed that I paid USD Prices when I clicked on the Canadian flag and signed in with my account. This preference should be saved under your account information. If I cannot tell which currency I am paying in, I will not return to this site. Also an estimation on duties should some how be communicated. One bag was perfect, the other had lots of tarnish on the steel trim that I wish was mentioned in the description.

author: Shopper in VA
text: The picture of the wallet I ordered did not accurately display the amount of wear or blemishes on the wallet. The description mentioned some wear but it was intentionally vague and nondescript. TRR should display numerous—varying angles—pictures of the items it sells. It should be required that blemishes are pictured as well. Shoppers understand the merchandise is used but shouldn’t be surprised by its condition when product arrives. The shipping process is not transparent and delivery messages are not sent, only first shipping notification. The time from purchase to shipping varies with no notification until item is shipped.
title: Inaccurate picture of product
